string.name: OperationManual
string.br: \n\nSelect the proper recording and backprojection values for the source_to_phantom, phantom_to_detector and slice_size. The slice_size corresponds to the size of the Field of View for reconstructed cross section image. The slice_position value places the FOV at the selected position along the Z axis. Reconstruction is taken place in the plane parallel to the XY plane. The rotation_step says how often your original X-ray projections, while rotating the coupled source and detector around the sample, are taken.
\n\nDefault values are written in the corresponding fields. Everything but the rotation_step are measured in points (voxels, or pixels). For now, the thickness of reconstructed slice is only 1 point.

\n\nBackprojection is started by clicking the START BACKPROJECTION button. You can cancel the reconstruction anytime by pressing the CANCEL BACKPROJECTION button. In both cases, the results will be saved to the /Downloads/ folder as *.png image with the name constructed from the word "slice" and the current time stamp (something like "slice_26072021124605.png").

\n\nFor all these to work, you should have projection files named projection_0, projection_1, ... , projection_365 in your /Downloads/ folder. Some of these projections may be missing and the algorithm will skip their processing.
\n\nPlease contact me on arman.kussainov@gmail.com if you do not have your own projections.

\n\nUse this link to GoogleDrive to download sample projections, taken with 1 degree step, with default parameters. Google Drive interace allows you to download individual projections or you can select all of them and download in bulk.
